help.title: <u>Raphaels's Functions</u>
help.text: Well, this is my library. Here you will find some useful functions developed by me, most time savers. Give me suggestions and ideas if you like it.
help.title: General Information Functions
help.text: Functions that gives you some kind of information about tibia.

function.name: boatprice
function.description: Returns the cost to travel from source to destination.

function.name: canlevitate
function.parameters: number x, number y, opt number z
function.description: Returns if the specificed tile has enought crates/boxes etc to levitate.

function.name: flasks
function.description: Returns the number of visible small, medium and large empty flasks

function.name: gold
function.description: Returns the number of visible gold, including platinum and crystal coins

function.name: exptolvl
function.description: Returns the amount of exp needed to reach level level from level baselevel. If you don't specify baselevel it will be defaulted to 1.

function.name: finditem
function.description: Returns the location of the first item of id id in the screen. If you don't want to get the first one, specify index.

function.name: listversion
function.description: Returns Item ID List version.

function.name: getcont
function.parameters: opt string location, opt boolean bpsonly, opt number index
function.description: Returns all visible containers. Optionally, you can specify the location for it to search. If you don't want the script to consider any container, you can specify bpsonly to true, and it will only look for backpacks. Also, you can choose to get only one id, using the index parameter.

function.name: iscursonin
function.parameters: number sx, number sy, number fx, number fy, opt boolean area
function.description: Returns true if mouse is inside the area specified by sx, sy, fx, fy, Optionally, you can specify area as true to make fx and fy the side of the rectangle, instead of the other point of it. Example: iscursorin(30, 25, 60, 45) = iscursorin(30, 25, 30, 20, true)

function.name: sstime
function.description: Returns the time to the next server save on world world, in seconds. Example: sstime('pacera')

help.title: Scripting Help Functions
help.text: Here are some functions that might help you to write your own scripts. That doesn't mean the other ones might not.

function.name: beep
function.description: Simply plays a beep.

function.name: cettime
function.description: Returns current time in CET, in seconds.

function.name: cetoffset
function.description: Returns the offset from your current timezone to CET, in seconds.

function.name: distto
function.parameters: int fx, int fy, int fz, int sx, int sy, int sz, bool anyfloor
function.description: Returns the first distance between the two group of coordinates. Optinally set anyfloor to true in order to make it accept any floor, instead of only the current one. If anyfloor is not true and the character isn't in the same floor, it will return -1.

function.name: dropflasks
function.description: Simply moves all flask to ground.

function.name: exec
function.description: Executes the code inside the string execstring. Example: local command = 'say("wassup dude")' exec(command)

function.name: findrope
function.description: Looks for any rope in the characters inventory/hotkeys, and return its name.

function.name: findshovel
function.description: Looks for any shovel in the characters inventory/hotkeys, and return its name.

function.name: get
function.description: Returns the value of the setting setting. Uses getpath function to get the full path.

function.name: getpath
function.description: Returns the full path to the setting setting. If it can't be found, returns nil.

function.name: math.format
function.description: Returns a string representation of the number n, matching the specified pattern. Example: math.format(30, "000.0") --> 030.0 math.format(30, "0.00") --> 30.00 math.format(30.25, "0.0") --> 30.25

function.name: moveitemlist
function.parameters: string locationto, string locationfrom, string/number item1, string/number item2, ...
function.description: Moves all items written in itemlist to locationto. If you specify locationfrom it will get only items from that location. Example: moveitemlist('brocade backpack', 'red backpack', 'cyclops trophy', 'halberd', 'cyclops toe')

function.name: movewhilemoveable
function.parameters: number x, number y, number z, opt number dx, opt number dy, opt number dz
function.description: Moves all items from location x, y, z;/i>, while it's moveable. Optinally, you can specify dx, dy, dz;/i> as destination. Example: movewhilemoveable(1234, 4567, 9)

function.name: npctalk
function.description: Will make your character say all text parameters given, in NPC channel. If it's not open, it will say the first phrase in default chuannel, and wait until it opens. Example: npctalk('hi', 'deposit all', 'yes', 'balance')

function.name: pm
function.parameters: string message, string player1, string player2, ...
function.description: Will message all players. First it will check if the correspondent channel is open, if it's not it will pm the player using '* playername * message' format.

function.name: set
function.parameters: string setting, string value, opt bool updategui
function.description: Sets any setting of the bot to the value specified by value. The full path will be get using getpath function and value must be one of the possible values for that field typed in exactly as it appears in the settings. Optionally, you can pass false as the third paramater to prevent the value from updating in the GUI until you move your mouse over the setting. This is to speed things up since redrawing GUIs can be expensive on the CPU.

function.name: sethealrule
function.parameters: string rulename, opt string hprange, opt string mprange, opt string method, opt string condition, opt string spam
function.description: Simply set all settings of a HealRule. If any setting is not specified or empty, this one will not be modified. Examples: sethealrule('HealRule1', '300-900', '0-50%', '', 'if paralyze') sethealrule('HealRule1', '', '', 'health potion', 'paralyzed') sethealrule('HealRule1, '300 to 900', '0 to 15%', '', 'none', '200-400')

function.name: sethotkey
function.description: Sets the hotkey hkname to state state. state will be converted using toyesno() function.

function.name: string.at
function.description: Returns the nth chracter inside string text.

function.name: string.cap
function.description: Returns the string text with first letter in upper case and all others in lower case. Example: string.capitalize('this is A TEST') --> 'This is a test'.

function.name: string.capall
function.description: Returns the string text with the first letter of each word in upper case and all others in lower case. Example: string.capitalizeall('this is A TEST') --> 'This Is A Test'.

function.name: string.capitalize
function.description: Returns the string text with first letter in upper case and all others in lower case. Example: string.capitalize('this is A TEST') --> 'This is a test'.

function.name: string.capitalizeall
function.description: Returns the string text with the first letter of each word in upper case and all others in lower case. Example: string.capitalizeall('this is A TEST') --> 'This Is A Test'.

function.name: string.end
function.description: Returns wheter text last characters are lt;i>substr.

function.name: string.explode
function.description: Returns a table with all sub-strings split by separator. Example: string.explode('Hello # My # Name # Is # Anonymickey', '#') --> table = {'Hello', 'My', 'Name', 'Is', 'Anonymickey'}. Credits to Socket and Hardek for this one.

function.name: string.starts
function.description: Returns wheter text first characters are lt;i>substr.

function.name: string.sub2
function.parameters: string s, number i, opt number l
function.description: Returns the substring of s that starts at i and continues for l characters.

function.name: sqmWidth
function.description: Returns the width of each sqm in your screen.

function.name: table.find2
function.description: Returns the index of value inside table, nil if it can't be found. If you don't specify notable as true it will search inside any table in the main one and return the index inside that secondary table also, as a secondary parameter. Optionally, you can specify arg if your main table is filled with other tables, and the function will look only on this index. You can also set argonly if you don't want to search for values outside secondary tables. Examples: table.find2(t, 'distance') table.find2(t, 'distance', 'type') table.find2(t, 'distance', 'type', false, true) table.find2(t, 'distance', '', true)

function.name: table.isempty
function.description: Returns true if table t is empty.

function.name: table.random
function.parameters: table t, number start, number finish, opt number count, opt number step
function.description: Returns a table filled with random numbers between start and finish. If count is specified, it's the maximum length of the table, meaning it will return only count random numbers inside the given range. You can also specify step, wich means it will count only multiples. Example: table.random(5, 10) --> {7, 10, 9, 8, 5, 6} table.random(5, 10, 3) --> {7, 10, 9} table.random(5, 10, 0, 2) --> {7, 9, 5}

function.name: table.size
function.description: Returns the number of components inside the table.

function.name: time
function.description: Returns a string representation of a second time interval n in the format "dd:hh:mm:ss" depending on lenght. Optionally, you can set the format by specifying pattern parameter. Examples: time(5000) --> 01:23:20 time(5000, 'hh:mm') --> 01:23 time(30) --> 00:30

function.name: timezone
function.description: Returns a string with your time zone based on your current location. Example: timezone() --> GMT -2 (If you are from Brazil)

function.name: toyesno
function.description: Converts the argument in 'yes' or 'no'. arg can be a boolean value, a string (which will be always 'yes', unless it's 'no' or empty), or a number (which will be always 'yes', unless it's 0).

help.title: Character Info Functions
help.text: Functions that can give you information about your character.

function.name: bestskill
function.description: Returns a table with type, skill and skillpc of the your highest skill.

function.name: levelpc
function.description: Returns the percent missing for you to advance a level.

function.name: maxcap
function.description: Returns the estimated maximun capacity of your character, based on vocation() function.

function.name: skilltime
function.description: Returns estimated time to advance in skill skilltype in seconds. skilltype can be: 'magic', 'fist', 'club', 'sword', 'axe', 'distance', 'shielding and 'fishing. Note: It will only start to 'analyze' when you run it for the first time. Example: skilltime('sword')

function.name: utctime
function.description: Returns current time in UTC, in seconds.

function.name: utcoffset
function.description: Returns the offset from your current timezone to UTC, in seconds.

function.name: vocation
function.description: Returns your character vocation. It will try to differ druid from sorcerer checking if it's wearing any rod/wand, if it's not it will return only 'mage'. Also, if it's not possible to determinate your character vocation by any method, it will return 'unknown'.

function.name: weaponskill
function.description: Returns a table with type, skill and skillpc of the your current weapon skill.

help.title: File Handling Functions
help.text: These functions will help you when working with files, reading, writing, anything related to it.

function.name: clearfile
function.description: Erases all the content inside file filename. Example: clearfile('test.txt')

function.name: createfile
function.description: Creates a file with the name filename, if it doesn't exist. Example: createfile('test.txt')

function.name: execfile
function.description: Executes the code inside the file filename. Example: exec('test.txt')

function.name: isfileline
function.description: If text is a line inside file filename, returns line number, false otherwise. Example: isfileline('test.txt', 'test')

function.name: createfile
function.description: Creates a file with the name filename, if it doesn't exist. Example: createfile('test.txt')

function.name: filecontent
function.description: Returns the content of the whole file filename. Example: filecontent('test.txt')

function.name: fileexists
function.description: Returns true if the file filename exists, false otherwise. Example: fileexists('test.txt')

function.name: fileline
function.description: Returns line of number linenum of the file filename. Example: fileline('test.txt', 10)

function.name: filelinescount
function.description: Returns number of lines of file linenum. Returns 0 if it doesn't exists, or if it's empty. Example: filelinescount('test.txt')

function.name: filewrite
function.description: Writes text in the file filename. Example: filewrite('test.txt', 'This is my test.')

function.name: filewriteline
function.description: Writes text in the file filename. Example: filewriteline('test.txt', 'This is my test.')

function.name: filerewrite
function.description: Clears the file filename and writes text in it . Example: filerewrite('test.txt', 'This is my test.')

help.title: Input Functions
help.text: Here are some general functions, I will probably organize it better later.

function.name: keyid
function.description: Returns the correspondent hexadecimal code of key key. Useful if you don't want to keep looking at internet lists while using keyevent(..) function. Example: keyevent(keyid('tab')) or keyevent(keyid('a'))

function.name: press
function.description: Presses the keys inside the string keys. Special keys MUST be inside [brackets]. Example: press('account[tab]password[enter]')
